metadata.name: 百鬼夜行 ｰ 餓者髑髏　#Iris
metadata.description:
《Hyakki Yakō ｰ GASHADOKURO #Iris》

Creator: Futaba (Twitter→@futaba_nft0401)  
Size: ‪‪3,000 × 3,000‬‬ dpi png

It is being aired on Shibuya Scramble Crossing Large Vision.（2022.11/1〜31）

GASHADOKURO limited edition "Iris" from the "Hyakki Yakō" series based on Japanese Yōkai.

Hyakki Yakō: 百鬼夜行, Night Parade of One Hundred Demons  
Gashadokuro: 餓者髑髏, starving skeleton

Gashadokuro is a Japanese Yōkai, a giant skull formed from the skeletons and grudges of the dead who were not buried in their graves. They wander around in the dark of night with a clattering sound, and find a live human, they attack and eat it.

In this work, flowers (=life) in the form of pear-shaped diamonds are contrasted with a skull (=death).

The subtitle "Iris" is named after the Japanese iris, the flower of Shibuya Ward, Tokyo, and the entire work is based on the same purple color as the flower.
